options-menu.joystick: Définir les contrôles de la manette de jeu

info.welcome:
Bienvenue sur SuperTux Advance! Ce message ira
quand vous vous éloignez du bloc.

Appuyez sur F1 si vous voulez voir les commentaires du jeu
de Kelvin Shadewing.
info.tutWall:
Maintenez le SAUT et appuyez loin du mur pour effectuer un
saut mural.
info.tutSlide: Appuyez sur EN BAS tandis que en courant à diapositive.
info.waterjump: Maintenez SAUT lorsque partant le eau à prendre de la hauteur.

devcom.welcome:
If you're seeing this, you have activated developer
commentary mode. Touch the red scarves to read
notes on the game's development.
devcom.hiff-0:
One of the many things that made me hiff was making
deathcaps walk up this hill. For whatever reason,
having them check twice as far ahead made them
behave properly...
devcom.pipes:
I was going to have the pipes behave the same as
the ones in Mario, but I found it annoying in those
games having to tap up/down to find which ones were
open, so instead, you just fall in.
devcom.firetux:
Originally, Fire Tux was going to have a helmet, as
in the original SuperTux. A member of the SuperTux
Discord server suggested using the design by Rusty
Box. I agreed it looked better. The original can
still be found on OpenGameArt.org.
devcom.coins:
Coins are purely for achievements. I never liked
the extra lives mechanic, as it just means making a
player wait even longer to try a level again if
they get a game over. I didn't want to get rid of
coins entirely, though, since that would make the
levels too barren.
devcom.sliding:
The mechanic of increasing speed from dropping off
a ledge came from needing to compensate for slopes
not accelerating the player enough. It's tech-
nically a glitch that I decided to throw in because
it was fun. Many mechanics are actually that.
devcom.trees:
Trees don't grow in Antarctica. That's why penguins
carve them out of ice.
devcom.snakes:
I know it makes about as much sense to have snakes
in Antarctica as it does to have hungry plants.
devcom.waterfalls:
This part of the cave looks especially nice to me.
I love the spacious background with waterfalls in
front of it. I wanted the level to feel like you
were meant to explore it, so a scene like this that
makes it feel big is meant to convey a sense of
exploration.
devcom.loops:
Sorry, did you expect this loop to work? Ha! I'm
nowhere near good enough to program that... yet.

npc.rad0:
Hé, où est ta planche ? Est-ce que tu vas glisser sur
votre ventre comme un carré ? Je parie que vous ne pourriez pas obtenir
chaque pièce de monnaie sur cette colline comme qui. Si vous le faites,
Je te donnerai quelque chose qui vous aidera vraiment
cprenez l'air !
